ocremixupdater
Class DBAccessThread

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Integer>
      ocremixupdater.DBAccessThread
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Object>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.lang.Object>
public class DBAccessThread
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Integer>

A SwingWorker thread for performing various database operations in the background and displaying the results asynchronously on the main window.

Use accessDatabase() to interact with this class, rather than creating DBAccessThreads manually. I mean, it's not that hard, but why not use the convenience function.

accessDatabase

public static void accessDatabase(ReMixDatabase data,
                                  DBAccessThread.DBMode mode,
                                  OCRemixUpdaterView view)
Create and run a DBAccessThread to do the selected operation.

Parameters:
data - The database.
mode - Whether to read the list file, write the list file, or scan the filesystem for the mp3s.
view - The OCRemixUpdaterView to display the results on.
